intro: Cynorkis arnottioides, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and moderate watering.
